comments.author: ppriu@yahoo.com
comments.creator: ppriu@yahoo.com
comments.raw_text:
User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 6.1; en-US) AppleWebKit/534.16 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/10.0.648.151 Safari/534.16
Build Identifier: Thunderbird/3.1.9

I created a list of 20 email addresses I send to a group.  One member of the list changed his email.  I edited his email, and the new email was shown on the list.  When I sent the next list email, the email went to his old email address instead of the new one.  I checked his address book entry and his entry on the list, and both showed the correct new email address.  However, the email still went to the old address.  The only way to fix the problem was to completely delete the list and create a new one using the correct new address.

Reproducible: Always

Steps to Reproduce:
1.create a mailing list
2.edit an email address on the list
3.send an email out, and you will find it goes to the old pre-edit email address.
Actual Results:  
The edited email address was not actually changed, even though it appeared so on the list.

Expected Results:  
I expected the email to go to the updated address, not the old one.

comments.creator: dlenne@web.de
comments.raw_text:
This seem to be mostly solved for 78.2.1 on windows 10.

action:
open contact in mailing list by double click
modify email address in contact window
close contact

result:
unmodified email address appears in mailing list, but an email sent via - context menü - create email will be sent to the modified address.

expected result:
modified email address appears in mailin list displayed.
